intro: Eugenia calciphila, commonly known as the limestone guava, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in calcareous soils. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers. Its fruits are small, round, and typically have a pinkish or reddish color when ripe. Eugenia calciphila is valued for its ornamental qualities and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
